courseOutline.content: This week introduces the fundamental concepts of physics, including its scope, importance, and real-world applications.
Learn about the SI units of measurement, precision, accuracy, and tools for measuring physical quantities.
Understand the laws of motion, kinematics, and the relationship between velocity, acceleration, and displacement.
Explore the concept of force, Newton's laws, and their applications in everyday situations.
Study the definitions of work, energy, and power, including kinetic and potential energy calculations.
Learn about momentum, impulse, and their conservation in closed systems.
Understand rotational dynamics, angular velocity, and moments of inertia.
Study the law of universal gravitation and its applications in planetary motion.
Learn about oscillatory motion, restoring forces, and energy in simple harmonic motion.
Explore the properties of fluids, buoyancy, and the principles of fluid dynamics.
Explore the history of atomic models, electron configurations, and periodic trends.
Learn about ionic, covalent, and metallic bonding and their properties.
Understand chemical equations, mole concept, and calculations based on stoichiometry.
Study solids, liquids, and gases, along with the kinetic molecular theory.
Learn the principles of thermodynamics, including enthalpy, entropy, and Gibbs free energy.
Understand the rates of chemical reactions and factors affecting reaction speed.
Study the concept of chemical equilibrium, Le Chatelierâ€™s principle, and equilibrium constants.
Learn about pH, strength of acids and bases, and buffer solutions.
Understand redox reactions, electrochemical cells, and their applications.
Explore the basics of organic compounds, including nomenclature and functional groups.
Understand the importance of effective communication in academic and professional settings.
Learn how to analyze problems and make logical decisions.
Explore ethical decision-making and the role of values in society.
Study the impact of human activities on the environment and sustainable solutions.
Learn about cultural differences and their influence on global interactions.
Understand strategies for effective time management in personal and professional life.
Learn the importance of collaboration and skills for working in teams.
Study the qualities of effective leaders and leadership styles.
Explore strategies for managing and resolving conflicts.
Learn how to set goals, build self-awareness, and achieve personal growth.
Introduction to algebraic expressions, equations, and inequalities.
Study of functions, domain, range, and graphing.
Understanding the concept of limits and continuity in calculus.
Basic differentiation rules and applications.
Introduction to integration and techniques of integration.
Matrix operations, determinants, and systems of equations.
Exploration of arithmetic and geometric progressions.
Introduction to vector algebra and applications in physics.
Basic concepts of probability and combinatorics.
Descriptive statistics and introduction to data analysis.
Overview of physics principles and their significance.
Understanding quantities in physics and their applications.
Study of motion in one and two dimensions.
Newton's laws of motion and force applications.
Work, energy, and power concepts in physical systems.
Principles of momentum and collisions.
Centripetal force and motion in circular paths.
Introduction to wave properties and behavior.
Study of heat, temperature, and thermal expansion.
Charge, electric fields, and potential.
Basic atomic structure and models.
Understanding periodic trends and element properties.
Ionic and covalent bonding principles.
Quantitative relationships in chemical reactions.
Behavior and properties of gases, liquids, and solids.
Energy changes in chemical reactions.
Dynamic nature of equilibrium in reactions.
Concepts of pH, acids, bases, and titration.
Electron transfer and balancing redox equations.
Introduction to hydrocarbons and functional groups.
Classification of matter and measurement techniques.
Structure and properties of atoms and molecules.
Types of reactions and balancing equations.
Properties of solutions and concentration calculations.
Energy changes and thermodynamic principles.
Factors affecting reaction rates.
Introduction to acid-base theory and titration.
Redox reactions and electrochemical cells.
Basics of polymer chemistry and applications.
Chemistry of air, water, and pollution.
Functions of multiple variables and partial derivatives.
Introduction to first-order and higher-order differential equations.
Gradient, divergence, and curl concepts.
Study of complex numbers and their applications in engineering.
Transformation techniques for solving differential equations.
Analysis of periodic functions using Fourier series.
Introduction to numerical approximation techniques.
Probability distributions and statistical inference.
Optimization methods in mathematical modeling.
Case studies of mathematical applications in real-world engineering problems.
Advanced mechanics, including rotational motion and angular momentum.
Newton's law of gravitation and orbital mechanics.
Study of simple harmonic motion and damped oscillations.
Properties of fluids, pressure, and buoyancy.
Heat engines, laws of thermodynamics, and entropy.
Electric field lines and potentials.
Magnetic force, fields, and electromagnetic induction.
Wave propagation and the electromagnetic spectrum.
Introduction to quantum mechanics and relativity.
Real-world applications of advanced physics in technology.
Study of transition metals and coordination compounds.
Spectroscopy, chromatography, and qualitative analysis.
Enthalpy, entropy, and free energy changes.
Mechanisms and factors affecting reaction rates.
Detailed study of functional groups and organic synthesis.
Polymerization techniques and industrial applications.
Study of pollutants and green chemistry principles.
Adsorption, catalysis, and colloids.
Applications of electrochemical cells in energy storage.
Chemistry in industrial processes and materials science.
Development of analytical and logical reasoning skills.
Impact of globalization on culture, economy, and society.
Understanding environmental challenges and sustainable practices.
Principles of starting and managing a business.
Improving written and oral communication skills.
Exploration of ethical principles and leadership styles.
Techniques for resolving interpersonal and group conflicts.
Skills for effective teamwork in academic and professional settings.
Influence of technology on modern society.
Understanding rights, duties, and active participation in governance.
